Leeds Ethical Hacking Society
We’re a Student Run Society exploring the World of Information Security

Cybercrime and Security Innovation Centre Launch Event

Date: Wednesday 6 April
Time: 1.30pm-18:00
Venue: James Graham, Headingley Campus
Leeds Beckett University are proud to host the Cybercrime and Security Innovation Centre Launch Event.
The event will include guest speakers, panel discussion and the opportunity to network.

Our speakers include:

Cybercrime and the National Challenge for Policing - Giles Herdale, Head of Digital Intelligence and Investigation Strategy, Police Service
The State of the Information Security Industry - Ian Glover, President, CREST

Panel discussion with:

Emlyn Butterfield, Senior Lecturer in Digital Forensics, Leeds Beckett University
Dr Tom Chothia, Senior Lecturer in Computer Security, University of Birmingham
Dr Tom Cockcroft, Principle Lecturer in Criminology, Leeds Beckett University
Professor Jiamei Deng, Leeds Beckett University
Ian Glover, President, CREST

About Us

The Leeds Ethical Hacking Society is a Leeds Beckett SU Society which has over 50 active members. We aim to offer students of all skill levels the ability to learn more about the information security world, the careers available, and an insight into the jobs themselves. During weekly meetings we will cover a topic relating to information security in some capacity, we frequently have guest speakers from industry coming in and presenting talks.

The Committee

The Ethical Hacking Society committee is made up of 6 members who are all current students at Leeds Beckett University. Together we help organise sessions, plan events, and reach out to industry for visits, talks, and career opportunities.
